questions.question_text: How long are quarantined files stored in the CrowdStrike Cloud?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
30 Days in host
90 Days in Cloud

Selected Answer: B
Answer B : 90 days on cloud.

Hi,

I working everyday with CrowdStrike, the quarantine file keep 30 days. So, the correct answer is C

Selected Answer: B
Confirmed 90 days on cloud.

comments.content: I agree > If they have not been released from quarantine, quarantined files are automatically deleted from the host after 30 days. Quarantined files are deleted from the CrowdStrike cloud (if uploaded for Falcon X etc.) after 90 days.

discussion.content: 90 days cloud. 30 days is for host.

Selected Answer: C
30 days. According to the CrowdStrike Falcon IT Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ), quarantined files are automatically deleted 30 days after the date of quarantine. Once deleted, they cannot be recovered.

comments.content: 30 days on host, 90 days on cloud. Once deleted from host, the status change from 'Quarantined' to 'Purged', downloadable from cloud if file size <32MB.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is the correct and only answer here.

questions.question_text: You are notified by a third-party that a program may have redirected traffic to a malicious domain. Which Falcon page will assist you in searching for any domain request information related to this notice?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I think this is A. The " Process Timeline" page says "Use this page to view all events associated with any user-specified Process Execution

comments.content: Also, the filters are Agent ID, Target Process ID, Parent Process ID, Event Types, Company, and Time Range. So I stand by A.

choices.B: All cloudable events for a specific host
choices.A: All cloudable process-related events within a given timeframe
choices.D: A view of activities on Mac or Linux hosts
choices.C: Only detection process-related events within a given timeframe

questions.question_text: What information is contained within a Process Timeline?
Sensor Visibility Exclusion patterns are written in which syntax?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer A, A. Glob Syntax 

Globs in the Falcon console
Glob wildcards offer flexibility when file names and directory structures vary across multiple hosts. For example, wildcards can match partial file names or match file names regardless of what directory they’re in.

Features that support globs:
Prevention policy exclusions. For more info, see Understanding prevention policy exclusions.
Falcon FileVantage file integrity monitoring rules and scheduled exclusions. For more info, see Falcon FileVantage.
Falcon Firewall wildcard IFN rules. For more info, see Manage your firewall rules and rule groups.
Falcon USB Device Control serial numbers used to create prevention policy exceptions. For more info, see USB Device Control.

Reference : In 2024, the Advanced event search will use the CrowdStrike Query Language (CQL).

Answer A, A. Glob Syntax 

Globs in the Falcon console
Glob wildcards offer flexibility when file names and directory structures vary across multiple hosts. For example, wildcards can match partial file names or match file names regardless of what directory they’re in.

Features that support globs:
Prevention policy exclusions. For more info, see Understanding prevention policy exclusions.
Falcon FileVantage file integrity monitoring rules and scheduled exclusions. For more info, see Falcon FileVantage.
Falcon Firewall wildcard IFN rules. For more info, see Manage your firewall rules and rule groups.
Falcon USB Device Control serial numbers used to create prevention policy exceptions. For more info, see USB Device Control.

Reference : In 2024, the Advanced event search will use the CrowdStrike Query Language (CQL).

Selected Answer: A
Correct is A

Correction:
IOA = Regex
Sensor Visibility = Glob Syntax

Selected Answer: C
The correct answer for Sensor Visibility Exclusion patterns in Crowdstrike is:
C. RegEx (Regular Expressions)

https://www.crowdstrike.com/blog/tech-center/custom-ioas/

Selected Answer: A
Checked on UI

Selected Answer: B
checked in docs

questions.question_text: In the "Full Detection Details", which view will provide an exportable text listing of events like DNS requests. Registry Operations, and Network Operations?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Process Table view shows File Name executing what; Process Activity view shows Events.

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer (I think) As you have 3 options. Process Tree, but you can only export PNG files, not text. Process Table does not have Events like DNS, IP operations, or Reg operations when you export. Process Activity does have Event types. I think it's D.

choices.A: The data is unable to be exported
